Posts.Content: Hi all, I am new to the group and wondered whether anyone has ever experienced what I am going through. I have stage one invasive ductal cell carcinoma. I had a lumpectomy on 13 September this year and thankfully the sentinel node biopsy results were good. I have found a small lump under my right ribcage and my GP is sending me for a scan but does not think it is anything to worry about. My query is that I have more or less constant pain in my upper body front and back, left and right. I am tying to reassure myself that perhaps due to the surgery I am not lying properly in bed and this is why I have the pain. I am a bit of a worrier and hope someone can offer some reassurance. Thanks

Posts.Content: Morning all I have had a bad back for a couple of weeks (not caner related) and I wanted to try a hand held ultrasound massager to help but someone told my husband I should not be using this or anything like it e.g. infrared light therapy. I started a 5 year course of Tamoxifen 2 weeks ago and will start my radiotherapy on 15 November. Does anyone know if it is ok for me to use the ultrasound please?
Posts.Title: Ultrasound for pain relief

Posts.Content: Hi, I can totally sympathise. Just after my lumpectomy in September I had a pain in my left side and found a small lump, and yes the brain went into overdrive. Fortunately my GP arranged an ultrasound and it was just a fatty lump and can you believe it once I was told that the pain `mysteriously` went! Everyone is giving you (and me incidently) very sound advice, all we have to do now is listen, not so easy I know but do keep trying. I am starting a mindfulness course next week arranged by a local cancer charity so I hope I can change how I react to these thoughts and not let them control me. Thinking of you, stay positive and keeping busy is really helpful (if you feel well enough of course). Take care
